str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
From hamartano; a sin.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Afflicted with paralysis. From a derivative of paraluo; as if dissolved, i.e. 'paralytic'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A couch, bed, portable bed or mat, a couch for reclining at meals, possibly also a bier. From klino; a couch.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
